pulfalight.title: Rename Plantain to PULFAlight within the codebase and documentation

comments.body:
Provisioned with ansible (follow-up PR to come) and deployed the app. I did some cleanup:

* Removed the old app config since we know having old app configs around can pollute env with bad values.
* turned off plantain workers service and deleted `/etc/systemd/system/plantain-workers.service`

Testing included:

* Checked `sudo passenger-status` to ensure the app was running from the new location
* Checked the UI to see that I can search, log in and create a bookmark

pulfalight.title: Remove all traces of plantain name; use pulfalight
Add circleci badge; fix coveralls link
Privilege description of materials over container information

comments.body: @apferrar What does this issue mean? What is the context?

@sdellis Hi Shaun- this relates to something the previous WG had discussed. This may be more of a design-related issue than one related to functionality(?); but as with the current site, we would like to privilege description over container information. So, rather than having description display as such: "Folder 2: Letter from Abraham Lincoln to James Gordon Bennett, 1865," where the container information is displayed first, we'd like the order to be reversed. (This is the collection I'm using as an example: https://pulfalight-staging.princeton.edu/catalog/C0094.) This method also makes sense since, as you know, the description of an intellectual grouping can be associated with several containers.

pulfalight.title: "Collection context" is introducing performance problems

comments.body:
More attempts to improve caching lead to the following errors with `solr_wrapper`:

```
org.apache.solr.common.SolrException: this IndexWriter is closed
```

...which is propagated from:
```
jetty.util.thread.strategy.EatWhatYouKill.runTask(EatWhatYouKill.java:333)
```

pulfalight.title: Replace solr_wrapper
How will we keep solr configs in sync with the ones in production on pul_solr?
Circleci needs to run solr 8

pulfalight.title: Components within certain Collections are breaking for the collection-level navigation
At the bottom of each collection page, the containers are being improperly displayed as collection members
"Scope note" fields should not be empty with "[]" characters
Overarching design of the site structure

comments.body:
Might it be possible to more closely follow the design for the collapsible finding aid view for PULFA 2.0?

Perhaps in the center of the page, there can be an expand/collapse interface component for viewing collection and component descriptions.

pulfalight.title: Reindex all collections for the staging environment
Compare the Collection and Component page design to the original wireframes from ArcLight

comments.body: This was initiated during the planning meeting held on 03/30, where it was determined that the "Collection Context" interface needed to be redesigned to more closely resemble the "table of contents" style design offered on PULFA 2.0.

It was also found that there may be inconsistencies between the community wireframes and the ArcLight MVP. It might be helpful to pose some questions with those who were involved in the production of the community wireframes.
From the ArchiveSpace PUI, there is a "table of contents" style interface component.

pulfalight.title: Wireframe a constantly-on table of contents view for collections
Remove the tab-based design for Collection and Component pages
Apply the PUL branding
Non-manifest digital object locations need to be indexed to a different field
Use the Blacklight range limit plugin for parsing and visualizing date ranges

comments.body:
We could avoid any warning with a better representation of the data in the facet. The Date Range facet in  PulfaLight should be consistent with the Date Range facet in OrangeLight, which gives a histogram of date ranges in the results and a link to "undated" material that can't be represented. See screen shot (although I don't know why it spans beyond the current year). 

![Screen Shot 2020-03-30 at 12.02.31 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba15f2e89c9c3b0c58e0d1/ae1140b9-d3c0-4126-8dc9-a555d954927d)
Invalid date years should not be rendered in the slider.

There are three possible cases which cannot be parsed into datestamps:

- Dates not examined (there may be dates but these were not found by those producing the EADs)
- Dates not found
- Dates which exist, but which cannot be parsed (e. g. "Easter Morning")

Facets will not directly map to the text which is rendered in the field for the record in all cases.

pulfalight.title: Change "Collection context" heading

comments.body:
We can use [the original wireframes for the Collection Context](https://stacks.stanford.edu/file/druid:hd302yz0755/Arclight-Mockups-MVP.pdf). See page 10, Component Details. For some reason, Stanford did not design this in accordance with the recommendations of their own UX team, but the original wireframe is closer to where we want to be. 

I think the problem with Collection Context is not the label, but that it's somewhat redundant with the hierarchy represented above it. If the "Collection Context" heading is still an issue after matching the original wireframe, we can look into changing the heading then.
Closed in favor of #206

pulfalight.title: Ability to search by box number and/or box and folder number

comments.body:
It's unclear to me why this has the "wireframe" and "visual design" labels. This is a fairly straightforward request to allow for searching for containers within a collection. 

However, rather than using underscores as suggested above (C1234_Box12_Folder2), I would use more common search syntax of quoting strings with spaces". 

So, if one searches for `C1234 "Box 12" "Folder 2"` the only search result would be the component in C1234 that has that container and sub-container.

pulfalight.title: URLs should only contain collection id once

comments.body: Resolved by #195

pulfalight.title: Repurpose bookmarks into cart/request functionality

comments.body: Given that a LUX component is being actively developed to produce a preferred solution for request management at the collection level (or for multiple components across collections), this has been deprecated in favor of just disabling the bookmark feature outright.

pulfalight.title: A show page should only have one viewer location

comments.body:
@hackmastera I'm not seeing child objects in your screenshots, but rather a redundancy with the current object's digitized content. Do you have examples of the digitized content for the child objects? (By `objects`, are we talking about components? Or are these objects with parent-child relationships in Figgy?)

A slightly related note: I also noticed essentially a "table of contents" that should probably be in the viewer for better UX/Usability, but is instead described in the EAD. Notice that his has children components here in PULFA:

https://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/C0744.03/c0002

But not here in pulfalight:
https://pulfalight-staging.princeton.edu/catalog/C0744-03C0744-03_c0002

pulfalight.title: Display folder number ranges at the parent level in addition to the extent note that says however many folders or containers are represented by the parent level

comments.body: @apferrar Is there a screen shot for this, or example we can see from the current site? This applies to any containers, not just folders, correct?

@sdellis Yes, Shaun; this would apply to any container. One example is here: https://pulfalight-staging.princeton.edu/catalog/C1352. Navigate to the component for "Reeve, Tapping, 1770-1810." The request is for all of the associated folders (the folder range) to display (after the unittitle) as well as the extent info, which in this case would be 5 folders.

bundle exec rake ci will fail with ruby 2.6.5:
```
Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem "railties":
  In snapshot (Gemfile.lock):
    railties (= 5.1.7)

  In Gemfile:
    rails (~> 5.1.7) was resolved to 5.1.7, which depends on
      railties (= 5.1.7)

    sass-rails (~> 5.0) was resolved to 5.1.0, which depends on
      railties (>= 5.2.0)

Running `bundle update` will rebuild your snapshot from scratch, using only
the gems in your Gemfile, which may resolve the conflict.
```
